job.title: Software Engineer (Python & Linux)
job.description:
Opentext - The Information Company
As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.
The Opportunity
OpenText builds breakthrough software solutions that harness the power of information to solve concrete business problems. Our patented innovations at the nexus of law, big data, and predictive analytics help extract critical insights from massive volumes of unstructured data - for eDiscovery, contract analysis, and enterprise knowledge management. With a world-class professional services team across the globe, OpenText is trusted by renowned corporations (BMW, Cisco, Swiss Re), premier law firms (Clifford Chance, Morgan Lewis, White & Case), and key regulatory agencies (SEC, DOE, FINRA).
Candidate must show aptitude troubleshooting technical issues in mission critical situations; possess strong analytical skills and superior communication skills. Candidate must be comfortable leading a team during a crisis.
You Are Great At
Develop and maintain the deployment and services of cloud SaaS offerings
Provide Level 3 support for OnDemand and SaaS customers including sending status updates to multiple audiences
Work seamlessly as part of an escalation team including proper handoffs and escalations
Participate in an on-call rotation
Install, patch and upgrade Recommind software
Design and communicate custom workflows, run books, and response documents
Take on special projects. Represent the department in meetings. Track and report on ongoing projects
Evaluate and maintain customized monitors
Provide scripted solutions to unique scenarios
Develop and maintain a deep understanding of OpenText’s Axcelerate product
What It Takes
The team is very open-minded to the tools required, currently including:
Scripting Languages and surrounding tooling (Python, Ruby)
Deployment and Configuration Management (SaltStack, Ansible, Terraform, CloudFormation, Puppet, Chef, Consul, Vault, etc.)
Monitoring tools (Nagios, Icinga, Zabbix, Cloudwatch, etc.)
Virtualization and Containers (Docker, Kubernetes/EKS, Vagrant, VMware)
Build Automation and testing (Jenkins, Gradle)
Analysis / statistics tools (ELK Stack, Grafana, Graylog, Splunk, LogRhythm, Excel, R, Stata, Scipy/Numpy, SQL, etc.)
Object Oriented Programming (Java, C++)
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent work experience required
AWS Certification preferred
Candidate must be an enthusiastic and fast-paced worker, able to solve technical challenges creatively in a dynamic environment
Excellent problem solving ability, verbal and written communication skills, work under strict deadlines in a legal environment and the ability to interact with all levels of staff necessary
Handle multiple tasks under challenging conditions as a team player
Minimum Slaary we are providing for this role is 125,000 USD/Year
